title: Ministers pledge Â£500m to support young families
content: A network of "family hubs" is to be funded in England to provide support services in one place.
en_title: Ministers pledge Â£500m to support young families
en_content: A network of "family hubs" is to be funded in England to provide support services in one place.

title: Online safety plans need more clarity, says Twitter
content: The government says it will tackle extreme posts but Twitter warns Ofcom will be "muddling through".
en_title: Online safety plans need more clarity, says Twitter
en_content: The government says it will tackle extreme posts but Twitter warns Ofcom will be "muddling through".

title: City regions to get Â£6.9bn for public transport
content: The chancellor will announce increased funding for tram, train and bus services in England.
en_title: City regions to get Â£6.9bn for public transport
en_content: The chancellor will announce increased funding for tram, train and bus services in England.

title: Ex-MP Frank Field reveals he is close to death
content: A statement from the veteran politician was read out in the Lords, backing a new assisted dying bill.
en_title: Ex-MP Frank Field reveals he is close to death
en_content: A statement from the veteran politician was read out in the Lords, backing a new assisted dying bill.

title: Victims to get more time to report domestic abuse
content: The home secretary wants to change the law after the BBC revealed a big rise in cases being dropped.
en_title: Victims to get more time to report domestic abuse
en_content: The home secretary wants to change the law after the BBC revealed a big rise in cases being dropped.

title: Government blocks law to curb fire and rehire
content: No 10 calls the practice "unacceptable", but wants new guidance for employers rather than a law.
en_title: Government blocks law to curb fire and rehire
en_content: No 10 calls the practice "unacceptable", but wants new guidance for employers rather than a law.

title: Give every household Â£320 for energy costs - Greens
content: The Green Party of England and Wales says the Â£9bn plan could be paid for with a tax on landlords.
